Reviews.Title: “Horrible, horrible service.”
Reviews.Author: Ckgba
Reviews.Content: The rooms are nice, lovely cleaning staff but the front desk and the "restaurant" provided no pleasant, polite staff. I was part of a touring group and found the staff at the reception treated me with no respect, spitting out answers to me as if my questions were stupid. I felt like they assumed superiority over me because I was apart of a group and didn't care how they treated me.

Reviews.Title: “It is great...if you can find it!”
Reviews.Author: funkygrl422
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel. Large, clean, beautiful facilities, near the train station, but it is not easy to find. The taxi drivers know it as the Former Centro Norte Hotel and you can access it from several streets. Once you find your way in, it is fantastic. You can walk to the train station easily. Don't pay the extra on-line to have wifi because it is free once you arrive!

Reviews.Title: “Its OK for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: calmacOxfordshire
Reviews.Content: A modern, clean hotel with good facilities but its just a bit..... boring. Location is also not that great for seeing any of the city. Free wifi available throughout the hotel and pool facilities looked good, although I did not get to try it out. Restaurant and bar are not somwhere you would want to take guests too, too clinical. There are a handful of reasonable restuarants locally but the location is a little bit out of the main thrum of the city. It worked for a one night business trip, but think I'll look for something else next time where I get to see a little more of the city in the few spare hours

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel in north of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Fifi_banana
Reviews.Content: If Trip Advisor had a Good rating I would have used it here - this hotel was better than average, but doesn't really justify very good - room was reasonably priced. Wasn't that impressed with area when I arrived, although hotel is close to metro. Room was a good size, clean, free wifi in room and breakfast was excellent. Rather grumpy and unhelpful at front desk when I arrived - got the impression that most staff don't speak much English.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing - freezing water in the bathroom”
Reviews.Author: MFRFr
Reviews.Content: I'm very disappointed of the service offered by the hotel for its range. During a one week stay, two mornings we got freezing water in the bathroom... And each time the front desk answered we should have had a shower half an hour earlier or later, which is for sure very unconvenient when you stay here for a business trip. The global feeling is disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “uncomfortable for business”
Reviews.Author: on_road_always
Reviews.Content: After 8 days, monday shower at 7 AM and sunday at 9.30 AM was COLD SHOWER. The only answer from the reception was "having a problem and you just have to wait 1 or 2 hours for Warm water" :). No discount proposed to apologize yet !! Only 2 lift for all the hotel require to wait more than 5 min every time. Stress for business=> to avoid !!

Reviews.Title: “Not fantastic, not so bad!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Difficult even for the GPS to find it! Nice accomodation with large room with 3 single beds... Noise in corridor at night promptly solved by security. Did not try breakfast. Free internet in the room!

Reviews.Title: “Fitness room- Excellent”
Reviews.Author: TNTNiemi
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not in the Centro of much of anything, across a barren strip of road at the side of a metro station, however it is easy access to anywhere in Madrid through the two metro lines nearby and even a quick trip to the airport by train. What really made this hotel fantastic was the fitness room! This isn't a gym that you have access to as a guest, it's a room type that offers not only a huge amount of space, but cardio equipment in your room. Since I was there for work, I had to get up early and came back relatively late to get to a gym, but having the equipment in my room was excellent. Great bed, very comfortable. Excellent staff, very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “just what you need”
Reviews.Author: ninita_bl
Reviews.Content: I was on business trip to Madrid (this was my second time, first in this hotel) and have stayed there for 6 nights. You can reach hotel by metro or taxi (around 28 euros). Hotel is situated next to one of the largest metro stations and train station, also just 5 minutes walk from famous 4 skycrapers and Plaza de Castilla. You can easily reach Sol by lightblue metro line No 1, it will take you straight to the most crowded place in Madrid in 15 minutes where everything begins. Hotel is actually looking at the building of a train and metro station and also on the left you can see the skycrapers and straight ahead an old construction ground. But hey...if you need a room with a view while in the city like Madrid then you are wasting your time. Rooms are spacious, extremely clean, bathroom is large with all the things you need. Since unfortunately I didn't get my luggage upon arrival and it was Sunday (so couldn't find a place to buy basic cosmetics), I was pleasantly surprised to see bath sponge, toothbrush, toothpaste, shoeshine in the room. Bravo! Breakfast was astonishing, huge selection between pastries, complete continental breakfast, jamon, cheese, fruits, special youghurts, churros con chocolate (must try, sort of finger doughnuts with chocolate, natural orange juice, great coffee and so on. Really, there's nothing you will miss (you will when you go back home :-))) ) Staff at the reception is very helpful and you can ask anything, they will try to help you. You can ask for city map when you arrive. There is also free wi-fi in the room, you will just need to ask a password at the reception for every next day. Signal is very good on every floor. So, since the hotel has everything you need and the center of the city is easily reachable, I would recommend it to everyone on any occasion.

Reviews.Title: “I was very impressed with this hotel, great service and acted like a 4/5* hotel”
Reviews.Author: smeedudet
Reviews.Content: Lovely big bedrooms, great service on the front desk. Although it's not based in central Madrid it is only a few tube stops from any of the places you want to go, and the hotel is right next to the tube station. It is nice because it is quieter at night time. Breakfast was not great, but you could see that they tried and staff were very helpful in the breakfast room.

Reviews.Title: “Average but not bad for price and location”
Reviews.Author: LondonTelegramSam
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right next to the Chamartin station but the access for cars and taxis is difficult unless you know the location. The views are ugly as well although you can also see the new 4 Madrid skyscapers. If you only need a room and do not want to pay a lot then this is nearly always a good place to stay but there are building works going on now and the breakfast is poor. If you are there is summer they have a nice pool, where you can swim real laps. But as a Tryp hotel it is below average in general.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: jmariemon
Reviews.Content: Walk out of the Chamartin metro station following the signs towards Plaza de Castilla, at the end of the parking lot, look right. The hotel is there. However, its proximity to the metro station does not translate into noise. Also, it is less than a 15 minute ride to Sol. We would definitely stay here again if we go to Madrid again. The room was clean and large. The staff was friendly and spoke English. The bathtub was nice and comfy. We were on the 12th floor with a view of the pool. We didn't get to use the pool as it was green and fuzzy (perhaps they stop cleaning it for he winter, but if you're looking forward to swimming, I would check first). We had three twin beds that were larger than normal twins. Two were pushed together. Our in-room safe didn't work. They said they would fix it but we never made arrangements to do so as we weren't staying very long and didn't want to wait around in the room for someone to come. We left with everything we came with! We paid 102 euro for a Saturday and Sunday night stay. Great deal.

Reviews.Title: “Not too shabby”
Reviews.Author: suttonin
Reviews.Content: This hotel was cool. Stayed here on a Contiki tour for 2 nights. The neighborhood is definitely far from the city center, but very close to the train station. However, the hotel is clean, well-kept, and not budget. I would sacrifice these things for a train ride to the city any day. The breakfast is also very diverse and tasty. It seems relatively modern with a nice theme, inticing pool, and flat screen TV. Shower is large and clean as well. The staff is not very nice and the wi-fi is extremely expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Good value. Clean and comfortable hotel. Outside of the centre, but Beside the Charmartin metro/train station.”
Reviews.Author: AmsterdamSheehan
Reviews.Content: We stayed in two of the Tryp chain of hotels when in Spain - one in Seville and one in Madrid. We got good deals online for both. We only paid 50 per night per room. Rooms were clean and air conditioned. The pool looked nice - but it didn't open until 12noon - so we never got to spent anytime there. We opted to have the breakfast for 8.50 each and it was well worth it. Altough we had to leave early to go to the airport this morning (before the breakfast restaurant opened, so we didn't have breakfast, but were still charged for it). If you don't mind being outside the centre -this hotel is a good option and with the metro/train station on its door step it is accessible every where..

Reviews.Title: “OK for one night”
Reviews.Author: Kasparainens
Reviews.Content: Was stranded in Madrid due to Iberias delayed flight and this hotel was supposed to serve economy class passengers. App 20 minutes by bus from the airport, older rooms but clean and well maintained. Mattress could be better. I like hard beds, but this was on the cheap side. Since our departure was early, couldn't test the breakfast buffet but what has been offered to us was simply a disaster. Swimming pool looked nice though, reception attitude was rather uninterested, but the guard exceeded all expectations in terms of assistance, hospitality and even English!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: lilypond_808
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is very well located, just a few steps from the Chamartin Metro and Train Station. I had a room in the 11th floor, which was excellent. Very nice views of the pool and the neighboring buildings. I had a single room and requested a double bed, no knowing if they could provide it, they did and the bed was pretty comfortable. The hotel was very clean and the bathroom in my room was shining. I could not use the pool because I didn't have time, but it sure looked big and very clean. Everything was perfect with my stay, but I am sorry to say this, the customer service was awful! When I arrived to the Lobby the Receptionist, an older Spanish woman, would not pay attention to the customers and she just kept talking with her colleague while doing the check-in it was so rude. She was not nice at all!!

Reviews.Title: “Staff need to learn manners”
Reviews.Author: LeedsMichelle
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 3 nights in a premium room. I didn't receive anything extra except for the premium bedding. But first when I went to check in I was told I haven't got a reservation I said I had. The woman at reception asked me to pay to use Internet & get ref number which I did (although it's free for premium guests) when I told her the ref number she still said no & came over to pc to check she then said I had to send her an e-mail. I was not impressed. When I got to room I phoned & Asked for water I was told no use bathroom water to drink. Also I asked for tea & coffee I was then told this is not normal although I had paid to be in a premium room. That was all in the 1st half hour of me being there. When I eventually got to speak to someone not the manager was 1 hour before I checked out. I told her everything she told me to see her when I did check out. I went to my room & everything that was missing was put in the room 3 days too late. I thought what an insult. When I checked out I was told if I come back I could have a free meal. Another insult I had paid for a premium room got none of the extras had to pay for Internet All in all customer service the worst I have ever had

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and it's near from railway station and metro”
Reviews.Author: Nica72
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a few meters from the railway station and metro.The staff is attentive but some more than others.The facilities are goods, the room is quite large and the bathroom also.There is a large swimming pool and the breakfast is complete and delicious.The value and what the hotel offers is compatible with a three-star hotel, a bit up I spent 04 days in this hotel and the free internet was not available. It takes about 25 minutes from the metro to the centre.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed - Sol Melia Platinum Card Holder”
Reviews.Author: brianraggett
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in Sol Melia hotels (including Tryp) almost every week for the past year. The only reason I chose this hotel is because it was relatively close to my office and next to the Renfe train station Chamartin. Compared to other hotels where I've stayed, I was definitely not impressed with this Tryp. The breakfast buffet was ok. The service wasn't bad, but wasn't as inviting as other Tryp hotels I've stayed at. The hotel rooms themselves seemed old and in need of renovation. I was under the impression there was a fitness center, after reading the description of the hotel. There was not, although we were allowed access to a nearby health centre for 20 euros. Anyway, not horrible but definitely not good.

Reviews.Title: “This place amazed me”
Reviews.Author: ali822
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as part of a trip for university. Absolutely great location to train station, literally on its doorstep in fact. Helpful staff, not snobby despite me looking a bit scruffy for fieldwork in the cantabrian mountains. Very nice spacious room with nice balcony. Lovely comfortable bed. Only complaint is the key system was a bit complex for me, would far prefr keys to cards. Probably one of the nicest places I have stayed and very conveniant for brwosing shops etc. Really enjoyed it.

Reviews.Title: “Great proximity to station”
Reviews.Author: LaurenS6
Reviews.Content: Very clean, nice rooms and bathrooms, has a pool, buffet restaurant, and smoking area on site. It is within a short walking distance to Chamartin station which is perfect to get to all areas of Madrid. There are steps up to the hotel and to the desk inside the hotel, they have a storage area for your luggage if you arrive early, like we did. Thankfully they had a room available so we were able to check-in early. There is a computer in the lobby which you have to pay to use, it is extremely slow and you are not allowed to print anything. There is also a payphone in the lobby, I suggest using a phone card. I would definitely stay there again and reccommend it to others traveling to Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient hotel, clean and functional.”
Reviews.Author: gatoAlfa
Reviews.Content: Easy to move around Madrid with the Chamartin station next door. Not much do do around the hotel, however the "Pepe" in the corner is convenient and serves good food. Breakfast buffet in the hotel is nice, get the rate with breakfast included. Dinner buffet is not cost effective, go to Pepe or eat at the train station. Internet access is expensive. If possible get a room rate with breakfast & internet; It is a good deal. Family rooms are nice for 2 adults & 2 kids/teens. Convenient hub for a vacation in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “strange experience”
Reviews.Author: tudomany
Reviews.Content: On the plus side, the hotel is conveniently located near the Chamartin railroad station and therefore taxis and the metro. We had a large, clean, quiet room and spacious bathroom. On the minus side, we had to haul our luggage up a steep flight of granite steps to reach the elevators, and then up some more steps to get to the front desk. Not that this is terribly important, but after I had registered, I was asked to sign another paper. When I asked what it was, I was told,"That you're here." But when I had a chance to read it, I had actually given my permission to receive email promotions from the Tryp Hotel chain. I feel the deception shouldn't have been necessary. There is a computer in the lobby, but one pays EUR 2.00 for 15 minutes, which is much more than the going rate.

Reviews.Title: “Don't book here ... my laptop, external memory and jewelery were stolen from the room”
Reviews.Author: JHBvisitor100
Reviews.Content: The hotel is central to a station and metro, but located in a noisy area at night. The bathroom was dirty, tiles cracked and was not stocked everyday. The beds were really substandard - not a good sleep experience. My laptop, external memory and jewellery WERE STOLEN FROM THE ROOM while we were out!!!! The only thing the management stand on is that there print out shows that nobody accessed the room with a card key except us. The reality is MY THINGS WERE STOLEN!! They did not attend to the issue and did not apologise once. No assistance to get the police. Do yourself a favour ... there are 100s of hotels in Madrid ... don't choose this one.

Reviews.Title: “Great public transport communication. Entrance To be improved”
Reviews.Author: MadridNorte
Reviews.Content: It is very suitable to move to the Center (10' in Cercania train to SOL), 20' with metro) and to the north (15' Alcobendas, San Sebastian thru Metro, Train, Bus), walking 5' to the 4 New Towers or Plaza de Castilla... The site is silent, but on saturday people making "botellon" could be noisy. The Entrance from Chamartin Station needs improvments Hotel WIFI is expensive, but cheaper WIFI is offered by privates (FON Community , <4€ day)

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel for everyone”
Reviews.Author: aikosh
Reviews.Content: Very convenient location, close to the stations (metro and train), clean and the staff is very helpful and friendly. Great view from the windows looking to the Plaza de Castilla. Very good value for money and they have a storage room for you to leave your belongings. They clean your room every day if you would like it. modern and new furniture and the room itself is very neat and quite big. The bathroom is clean and big. The only thing is that Wi-Fi internet is not free of charge and it is quite expensive.

Reviews.Title: “OK place to catch early train out of Chamartin”
Reviews.Author: rtpana
Reviews.Content: I got off the plane and traveled by Metro to Chamartin. Even though I had a Metro station change I never had to go up or down a set of stairs. Imagine my surprise when I was accosted with a steep set of stairs to get to the hotel lobby. So, I dragged my extremely heavy suitcases up then was told that I had to drag them halfway down to get the elevator to my room. Also, you cannot print directly from the internet but have to e-mail the hotel staff so they can print it out - this is very primitive and I should not have to send private information to the staff. The internet wa 2 euros for half hour but was very slow so you could not get a lot of work in. The rooms and bathrooms were comfortable and quiet. The location was very dead and the only reason we picked it was convenience to get Renfe trains but a regular tourist would be really inconvenienced to see the sights and get the real flavor of Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Liked it so well, we stayed twice”
Reviews.Author: Gail_Dowell_2004
Reviews.Content: Yes, it's hard to find. Don't trust the maps (or your GPS). Look at www.gomadrid.com/maps/madrid-map.html Calle de Mauricio Ravel does not go through from Calle de Mauricio Legendre to Calle de Augustin de Foxa. What you want is the little stub of a street that goes left from the top of Augustin de Foxa - yes, across from the Chamartin train and Metro station. Don't take the ramp up to Padre Francisco Palau y Quer. The front of the hotel faces the big vacant lot you can see if you click on "Satellite." Access is also available through the Centro Norte apartments that front on Mauricio Legendre 16. Do notice the hotel photo - there are steps from the street to the entrance, and more steps from the entrance to the front desk. All that said, this is a nice city hotel, and I agree with all the previous reviews (although we didn't get bathrobes!). The pool is very pleasant, but, again, not handicapped accessible - more steps. The Metro station is about 200 yards away, and the escalators are finished now. There are several "popular-with-the-local-residents" restaurants 2 long blocks away on Mauricio Legendre that have tables in the median in the middle of the street (dinner after 8:30 P.M.), and 2 bars / tapas places on Augustin de Foxa, right next to the hotel (may be a little loud at night).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: johno.franklin
Reviews.Content: As stated by other reviewers, this hotel is a bit hard to find at first. The entrance is placed oddly at what should have been the back of the building, opposite the Charmatin train and metro station. If you come by taxi, ask to be dropped off at the train station, on the ground level at the entrance to the metro. Once you enter the place, you realise that this hotel is destined for four stars. The lobby, although a bit quirky at the entrance as noted before, is functional with friendly and helpful staff. The rooms are excellent. Very roomy with a huge double bed, and all the facilities you would usually expect in any three star plus some extras. We were given a bath robe and slippers, and there were ironing facilities, as well as a hair dryer in the bathroom. The room was clean, no musty/cigarette smells, and had new modern decor. The only real complaint we had was we could not get the aircon/heating system to work properly. When we arrived housekeeping had set it quite warm, meaning the room was very hot. We solved this by just switching it off, and opening the windows for a few minutes. The rest of our stay we left the aircon system off, and that worked out fine. I would suggest though that if this occours to anyone else, then it obviously a hotel problem and one should then inform reception to get it fixed. The only times we used the restaurant was for breakfast, where we decided to go for the breakfast at 9 Euros a person. Granted this is a little on the steep side, but the buffet is excellent with a wide variety, and more importantly stays open until 11am - a godsent after those Madrid bars. As far as parking is concerned, the hotel does provide this but at an expensive rate of 25 Euros a day. We arrived on a Saturday afternoon, and found a spot on the street outside. Parking in these spaces is free on the weekend, and it was easy to find a spot then. We stayed through to Monday afternoon, and thus Sunday moved the car underneath a large roadway bridge just outside the station, opposite the hotel. This is parking in dirt, but the spots are not marked and neither are those spaces illegal, so if you arrive at a quiet time of day and have a bit of patience, you can find good street-side parking. The car appeared to be safe there, obviously you wouldn't park your Porsche 911 there nor anywhere else un-protected in any large city. The trip by Metro into Madrid from Charmatin is quite fast - although it appears far off it will actually take you no more than 10 minutes to reach Sol metro station. Charmatin metro station itself is an architectural marvel and almost worth a visit in itself. Overall we enjoyed our stay at this hotel thoroughly, and were pleasantly surprised by its high standards. If you can get a good rate, I would highly recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: bocalbabe
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I booked a room at this hotel while we were staying in Burgos, Spain. We weren't sure how things were going to turn out since we didn't know much about the hotel. Nonetheless, we were pleasantly surprised! From the airport, our taxi cost us around 20 dollars. The biggest problem was finding the place. We had the street address, but the driver couldn't find it. It's not located off of an actual road. He dropped us off at the Apartamentos Centro Norte and we took it into our own hands to search the area for it. After 10 minutes of looking around, we found it to be in an area of construction and parking, off of a street (basically to the back). If you are trying to get there by taxi (we learned soon after) it is located right next to the Charmartin Metro Station! I highly recommend talking to the hotel personnel about giving directions to taxi drivers. My boyfriend was staying over in Madrid another couple of weeks, so he switched hotels to Hotel Nuevo Madrid (due to a better price for the long run) and our taxi driver could NOT find it with the directions we got off of the website. So, it is a good idea to get driving directions for the drivers. The hotel personnel were friendly and spoke good English. We had no problem getting into our room, even when others warned of issues with booking online. Just bring all of your paperwork (confirmation numbers, etc) to be safe. The room was very comfortable and large (we just got a standard room with twin beds). The only problem with the twin beds is they roll apart. lol But, I think their twin bed size is bigger than American sized twins, so two people sleeping together in it is not uncomfortable at all. There are a few channels in English (MTV, CNN, and something else, which I cannot remember). The bathroom is very nice! Big bathtub with a great shower head. Also there's a bidet for all of you bidet lovers out there. ;-) Oh, when you walk into the room and the lights don't come on when you hit the switch, place the card in the slot next to the door on the wall. It's really a smart way to save on power...I don't know why more American hotels do that. This hotel also has a huge pool. It gets crowded though, especially in the summer months. The hotel offers a buffet breakfast for 12 euros per person. It was not included in our room. BUT, when we arrived two hours early to check in (and couldn't) the hotel clerk told us where the breakfast was. We went in (expecting to pay) and after we were through and asked for the bill, our waiter looked confused and said no problema, all is ok. So, we got our first breakfast for free. Hmmmm, this is terrible to say, but you could possibly take advantage of this situation and get it free since we just saw everyone get up and leave after eating...We didn't do this though and ended up getting breakfast in the city at cafes. All in all, it was a nice sized buffet with lots of good food (even for you picky eaters out there). I would recommend it if you weren't on a budget. We couldn't have asked for a better location to the metro. As you walk down the steps and to your right, the Chamartin station is the building in front of you. There are a lot of cars and construction around it. It's not really marked that well either. But, keep trucking and you will see the signs for the metro. There are a lot of steps at this station though, so if you are not able to climb up at the end of the day, then I would recommend staying somewhere else. I think since it is still under construction they don't have all the escalators working. Nonetheless, the 10 line is there and it takes you into the city. It is a new line with air conditioning. Very nice. For a little over 6 euros you can purchase a 10 ride pass. The metros are very easy to use and find. I highly recommend using this form of transportation. Taxis can get expensive.

HotelInfo.Name: TRYP Madrid Chamartin Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Mauricio Ravel 10, 28046 Madrid, Spain (Formerly Tryp Centro Norte)
